info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 08 at 6:37PM EDT until June 08 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Kenton County in northern Kentucky... Northwestern Bracken County in northern Kentucky... Campbell County in northern Kentucky... Northern Pendleton County in northern Kentucky... Southeastern Hamilton County in southwestern Ohio... Southern Clermont County in southwestern Ohio... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 637 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Independence, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Covington, Independence, Fort Thomas, Alexandria, Highland Heights, Taylor Mill, Southgate, Claryville, Amelia, Wilder, Bethel, New Richmond, Williamsburg, Silver Grove, Felicity, Butler, Melbourne, Riverbend And Coney Island, Coldstream and Withamsville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
